[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: from_decimals()] [Underflow Risk] Can from_decimals() be called on values < DECIMALS, rounding to zero and bypassing minimum withdrawal checks? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_oracle_price_decimals()] [Integer Overflow] Can v * 1e18 overflow u256 when v > 2^178, causing oracle price conversion failures in vault valuation? (Critical)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_oracle_price_decimals()] [Decimal Mismatch] Can mixing 1e9 and 1e18 decimals in calculations cause 1e9 error factor in vault USD value? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_oracle_price_decimals()] [Price Inflation] Can attacker exploit overflow to wrap price values, creating artificially low or high asset valuations? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_oracle_price_decimals()] [Unit Confusion] Can code incorrectly use to_oracle_price_decimals() on already-scaled values, double-scaling prices? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: from_oracle_price_decimals()] [Precision Loss] Can v / 1e18 truncate oracle prices, causing undervaluation of vault assets during loss tolerance checks? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: from_oracle_price_decimals()] [Price Manipulation] Can attacker time from_oracle_price_decimals() calls to exploit rounding, inflating share value? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: from_oracle_price_decimals()] [Zero Price] Can oracle price v < 1e18 round to zero after division, causing division-by-zero in downstream calculations? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: from_oracle_price_decimals()] [Round-Trip Error] Does to_oracle_price_decimals(from_oracle_price_decimals(x)) != x cause accounting errors in repeated valuations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Integer Overflow] Can v1 * v2 overflow before division when calculating USD value of large balances with high prices? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Division Error] Can dividing by ORACLE_DECIMALS (1e18) cause excessive precision loss for small balance * price calculations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Price Rounding] Can (balance * price) / 1e18 round down significantly, causing vault to undervalue assets and allow over-withdrawal? (High)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Overflow Wrap] When v1=2^200 and v2=2^100, does multiplication wrap u256, creating negative-seeming USD values? (Critical)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Zero Result] Can attacker craft v1 and v2 where (v1*v2) < 1e18, rounding to zero and bypassing loss_tolerance checks? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Cumulative Error] Do multiple mul_with_oracle_price() calls accumulate rounding errors, enabling theft through repeated small operations? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_with_oracle_price()] [Division by Zero] Can v2=0 (zero oracle price) cause panic during asset balance calculations in vault operations? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_with_oracle_price()] [Integer Overflow] Can v1 * ORACLE_DECIMALS overflow when v1 is large USD value, breaking balance-from-value conversions? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_with_oracle_price()] [Price Manipulation] Can attacker exploit (USD * 1e18) / price to inflate balance calculations when price is artificially low? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_with_oracle_price()] [Precision Inflation] When v2 is very small, does (v1 * 1e18) / v2 produce excessively large balance, breaking supply caps? (Critical)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_with_oracle_price()] [Rounding Error] Can (value * 1e18) / price round unpredictably, causing share-to-asset conversion inconsistencies? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: clone_vecmap_table()] [Loop Logic] Can empty VecMap cause keys.length()=0, resulting in i=0 and immediate loop exit, creating uninitialized table? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: clone_vecmap_table()] [Index Underflow] When i=1, does i-1=0 correctly access first element, or can off-by-one error skip entries? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: clone_vecmap_table()] [Duplicate Keys] Can VecMap contain duplicate keys due to external corruption, causing table.add() to panic during clone? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: clone_vecmap_table()] [Memory Exhaustion] Can attacker create extremely large VecMap, causing clone operation to run out of gas and DoS vault configuration updates? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: clone_vecmap_table()] [Reference Invalidation] Can t be modified during iteration, causing keys.borrow() to return stale data and corrupting cloned table? (High)
